fields.description:
There are a few housekeeping actions that I''m trying to do at the moment that'd be a lot easier if I could see completed tasks from old sprints on the greenhopped plan page.

For example, I'm trying to refactor the backlog with a new set of epics and I'd like to drag old tasks to the new epics so that we can get historical progress.  There doesn't seem to be a reasonable way to do this otherwise and the UI in the plan view makes it very easy (just drag and drop to the epic).
fields.summary: I'd like to temporarily show completed sprint tasks on the plan view
UpgradeTask to set started flag of all sprints

fields.description:
It would be great if we have an option to select which user we want to see when using the quick filters in the Work mode on JIRA Agile.

Today, we can create a quick filter to show issues from a specific user. But if we need to check from different users, we need to create a quick filter to each one, which is not practical.

A good option would be create a _select field_ showing the possible assignees, so we can choose one and use the quick filters based in the selected user.
fields.summary: Option to select a user when using quick filters

fields.description: As  user, I'd like to be able to create charts that show multiple sprints over my own pre-defined date range.
fields.summary: Rapid Board multiple sprint burndown chart

fields.description: The _Manage Boards_ screen used to display icons for every Board on the list, indicating the Board type (Kanban or Scrum). Those icons aren't there anymore, which is a shame - it was useful to know the Board configuration without having to open it.
fields.summary: Board type icons not displayed in the Manage Boards screen

fields.description:
Below the Burndown chart a table is shown listing all the actions done inside the Sprint (Issue added, time logged, etc.). In my opinion it would be nice to also show the person who performed that action either in a new column or after the "Event Type".

Thanks in Advance
Johannes
fields.summary: Show person who did the action on burndown summary
In order to better find my issues I would like to be able to use Epic or Version Names in the Instant Filter

fields.description:
It happens to be the case, that I am jumping around between various boards. And it also happens to be the case, that I want to access the one, which just dropped out of the recent items list:
http://screenshot.ivi-solutions.com/2012-10-18_1415.png

Is there any chance to extend the list to like 10 items, or configure it somehow?

Thanks!
Jan-Hendrik
fields.summary: More "recent items" for Agile

fields.description:
Due to various situations (such as work absence, system downtime, misconfiguration, and others), I need to update the JIRA and start a sprint with an earlier date.

Definitely, it is impossible to work without this functionality in scenarios where I, ScrumMaster, I do not have enough time everyday to update the JIRA.
fields.summary: As a scrum master I would start a sprint with an earlier date

fields.description:
Hi,
We use JIRA 5.0.7 and recently installed greenhopper 6.1.6 plugin for scrum.
I found that story and epic issue type were not added. But, related fields were normally added like story points, rank, etc.
I just removed and reinstalled plugin, but got the same result.

Can I just add custom issue types named story and epic and expect same fuctionality in the scrum projects?

Could you please help on these questions?
fields.summary: story, epic issue type missing after installing greenhopper plugin

fields.description:
As a product owner, I want to use the epic gadgets in a confluence page summary or jira dashboard summary to communicate the epic's overall status. 

This helps to fulfill a need of showing overall status of a product roadmap and portfolio.
fields.summary: Epic progress gadget

fields.description:
Currently in order to move issues from one sprint to another you have to clear the sprint, find the issue in the backlog, and then add it to another sprint.

It would be good if we could do that in one action just by dragging from one sprint to another.

We should also be able to do that in bulk too.
fields.summary: As a scrum master I would like to be able to drag stories from one sprint to another in one action

fields.description:
h3. Summary of Bug

For GreenHopper classic, there is the option to select which projects are enabled/disabled. When using the option of 'Apply to these projects', the user  is able to select which project can and which project cannot use the Classic Boards. However, it seems that they cannot disable all the projects

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Head to the 'GreenHopper Configuration' page in your JIRA Administration
# At the 'Enabled Projects' tab, try to first add all the projects into the 'GreenHopper Projects' list (This is because, by default, the radiobutton 'All Projects' are selected, thus no projects are in the 'GreenHopper Projects' list)
# Then, try to remove all of them
# When  you click on 'Modify' after removing all of them, the list will turn yellow, and nothing will happen. When the screen is refreshed, the projects are back i nthe 'GreenHopper Projects' list

h3. Additional Info

* This was tested in GreenHopper 6.2.1 and GreenHopper 6.2.2. 
* I've attached a video of how the bug occurs, so that it's more convenient
fields.summary: Unable to remove all enabled GH projects

fields.description: As a scrum master, I need to be able to easily see how much work is assigned to each developer (or group of developers) in planning mode so that the team members can evaluate whether they have a reasonable amount or not.
fields.summary: Support for Resource Management in Planning Mode

fields.description:
As a scrum master or product owner I need to be able to see groups of epics at the same time so that I can compare them together. One solution that wouldn't require any new UI elements would be to allow multi-selection of epics in planning mode. A better solution would be to have another panel to the left of the epics one for Themes.

(This primarily applies to planning mode.)
fields.summary: Support for Groups of Epics or Themes

fields.description: This means that when you update Sprint field from JIRA - Ranking is not updated - thus sorting by ranking no longer shows all items in the current sprint at the top. This affects all user's To Do filters and subscriptions (as these are sorted by Rank) meaning that they may skip something important.
fields.summary: Specifying "Sprint" from JIRA ticket does not update it's Ranking
Epic Name should be available for all issue types

fields.description:
On a Scrum board with swim lanes setup by Epic it currently shows how many issues there are in that subcategory.

Currently to view the status of these issues you have to expand that swim lane to review the issues.  

It would be beneficial and a time saver to have the ability to see the status of the issues in that epic in the form of "Not Started, In Progress, Done" just like in the top of the planning window.

I'm not sure if it would be better to have story points (like in planning) or number of issues.

I have attached a mock-up of what I was thinking.

Please feel free to reach out.
fields.summary: Swimlane by Epic Stats for minimized view
As a user I would like to see a notification for Issues that are blocked

fields.description:
Quite straight forward on this one. Basically, if you alter the *Rapid Board's* Filter Query to take on another parameter for the JQL that is being placed before *Rank ASC*, the board will not be able to interpret the JQL properly.

!scrum_1.JPG|thumbnail!

It means that even though *Rank ASC* is present in the query, you will not be able to *Create Sprint* because the button is disabled with the following message:
bq. The board must be ordered by Rank in order to add a sprint

!scrum_2.jpg|thumbnail!

Perhaps some improvement can be made so that the order of *Rank* field does not really matter?
fields.summary: GreenHopper Filter Query Rank confusion

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Software Cloud*. Using *JIRA Software Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSWSERVER-9037].
  {panel}

Epic names with & display incorrectly as as "&" 

see: https://support.atlassian.com/browse/JST-65786

Related JAC:

https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/GHS-2556

https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/GHS-5524
fields.summary: Epic names with & display incorrectly as as "&"

fields.description: We found that we have a Sprint what has no issues assigned to it but we are unable to remove it to resolve the issue.
fields.summary: Velocity Report - No issues present in sprint to generate scope change model

fields.description: In GreenHopper 6.2, the column headers are now very subtle. when attached to a TV display or projector, they're even more faded. Please check the screenshots to see the difference between the Old and the New look to better understand the request.
fields.summary: As an user, I would to have the old "Work" header in GreenHopper 6.2

fields.description:
Currently I have to enter the ID of the Sprint (which is not shown anywhere) so that I can create a bug ticket (for example) and assign it to a Sprint using the "Create" screen.
There should be a drop-down for Sprints to choose from not an ID... that is more than inconvenient
fields.summary: As User I want to create an issue and assign it promtly to a Sprint

fields.description:
Referring to the version report documentation,:
* https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/GH/Viewing+the+Version+Report

The explanation on the report on how the values are calculated was not really detailed. This had caused some confusion to user whom wants to have a better understanding on the report details.

For example, unclear terms and details are missing such as:
{quote}
the Predicted Release Date (blue line) – that is, the date at which you can expect all issues in your version to be complete, based on your average daily velocity and the amount of estimated work remaining.
{quote}
* how was the average value calculated and using what criteria to fill in the average?

How the percentage on the vertical axis(right hand side) was calculated and based on what criteria?
fields.summary: unclear terms and information in version report documentation

fields.description: "The current background colour for the columns is set to #F5F5F5, an ADG colour. I'd like to change that to #E9E9E9, also an ADG colour, to give it a higher contrast..."
fields.summary: Increase contrast of columns in work mode
Empty sprint progress badges have no height
empty active sprint message is wrong

fields.description: Detail View scroll tracker needs to be destroyed before page switch to prevent the error. We can likely do this in the hide function for Detail View.
fields.summary: Switching from Plan to Work while flagging is in progress results in JS error
Changes to Work mode column headers can obscure issues

fields.description: It would be useful to have the cycle time on a gadget on the dashboard, it would be easier this way.
fields.summary: As a user, I'd like to have a cycle time gadget on my dashboard

fields.description:
We have an issue/s that are not appearing on the Scrum Rapid Board Plan or Work Board. This is inconsistent and appears to have only seen to be an issue in 1 issue. I have reviewed the following help page but no information within the content is the issue or resolved the problem.

Wiki - Some issues not showing in plan or work mode of the board:
http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/GHKB/Some+issues+not+showing+in+plan+or+work+mode+of+the+board

The issue appeared on the Plan and Work board until we removed it from its current Sprint (Sprint 3) and attempted to return the item to the backlog. After performing this function, it did not return to the backlog, but was removed entirely from the Rapid Board.

This is critical since we truly are unaware of which items are being displayed on the Rapid Boards and which are not. We are working with a 3rd party company on this particular project and collaboration with them through the Rapid Boards is vital.

Also note: We have other Issues in the same state, criteria and status but do appear on the Plan Board without issue.

If you navigate directly to the issue detail, then click Agile > View on Board, JIRA states "There are no boards which contain this issue."
Screenshot: http://screencast.com/t/lAPBzIOgX

Project Name: DDB - RMHC Site
Project URL: https://reside.jira.com/browse/DDBS

Issue ID: DDBS-11
Issue URL: https://reside.jira.com/browse/DDBS-11

Rapid Board name: DDB - RMHC Site
Rapid Board URL: https://reside.jira.com/secure/RapidBoard.jspa?rapidView=64

Below is the checklist from the earlier referenced wiki article:
1. Check mapping of the columns

Mapping has been configured for all columns, each status is located within a column
Configure > Columns URL: https://reside.jira.com/secure/RapidView.jspa?rapidView=64&tab=columns

2. Check the issues whether it is return using the filter(Agile > Tools > Filter > View in Issue Navigator)

If I use a Project filter within Issue Navigator the Issue in question appears:
https://reside.jira.com/issues/?filter=14347&jql=project%20%3D%20%22DDB%20-%20RMHC%20Site%22%20ORDER%20BY%20key%20ASC%2C%20Rank%20ASC
Screenshot: http://screencast.com/t/wIt7R3cA5b

3. Check any quick filters has been toggle on which affect the search result

No quick filters are selected

4. Check any filter on the swimlanes which based on the queries

No filters / queries, Swimlanes are based on Stories.

---

Also reviewed the Query Limit setting and it is already set to Never Ask.
fields.summary: Issues not showing up in Greenhopper Backlog after being removed from Sprint

fields.description:
Currently it is not possible to assign whole Epics to a version.
It is possible to add all Stories of an Epic to a version using d&d, but we still do not see Epics in a Version... 

Because we usually release Features (Epics) and not individual Stories in a Version (production release) it is hard for us to track which features are in a version.
fields.summary: As Product Owner I want to assign Epics (with all its stories) to a Version

fields.description: Currently closed Epics just disappear... I can not check which Epics are closed in the current Sprint
fields.summary: As Scrum Master I would like to see closed Epics as well in my Sprint

fields.description: Using drag&drop an Epic I should be able to put all Stories of an Epic to a Sprint, it would make the process much quiecker
fields.summary: As Product Owner I want to put all Stories of an Epic more easily and see which Epic in the Sprint

fields.description:
Currently using Assignee swinlanes, I can see the number of my tasks, but not the sum of the remaining hours

John (2) (35 hours)
  Task 1 - 20 hours
  Task 2 - 15 hours

we have the "2" but "(35 hours)" is what we miss
fields.summary: As a Team Member/Scrum master I want to see the total estimate/remaining time per swimlane

fields.description:
Currently when planning a Sprint there are indicators about full size of the Sprint (e.g. 300 hours) and I know that in theory the agile teams should be cross-functional but in practice (and as it is clearly written in most PMI-ACP books) there is some level of role specialization.
So seeing that I'll have a 300 Sprint says nothing about if the Sprint is feasible or not, there should be a breakdown about how much task is assigned to each member like the classic JIRA "Version Workload Report".

So e.g. a short summary in Plan mode would be cruical so that we can plan a Sprint:

John: 30 hours (24 remaining)
Sarah: 40 hours (14 remaining)
.... (listing assignees with non-sum-zero of course)

This way i could tell that our current team can do the Sprint or not...

Current workaround:
1. Start the Sprint
2. Go to Work mode
3. Count manually using Assignee Swimlane
4. Remove/Add Stories so that the Sprint can be doable

It is extremely painful and when the customer is there (face to face planning meeting) is shameful, so usually we can prioritize but defer the final planning and negotiate the final Sprint plan offline with the customer.... not a real agile approach
fields.summary: As a Scrum Master I want to see the utilization of my team during Sprint planning meetings

fields.description: Currently long epic names are wrapped into multiple lines while Stories have huge unused space... makes it hard to prioritize Epics because the list is very long... not because of the number of Epics but because there are many names wrapped in 3-5 lines
fields.summary: Make the Epics/Version panel resizable in Plan mode

fields.description:
When we use Assignee swimlanes (most useful on Daily standups), we loose the Epic information... with Stories with very similiary names like "Login" it is very confusing.

It would be great to introduce nested swimlanes (e.g. Epics within Assignee) or a cheaper solution: label the story tickets in Work modes with the name of the Epic they belong to
fields.summary: As Team Member/Epics I want to use nested swinlanes (Assignee and Epics) in Work mode

fields.description:
It often happens that a team member has an improvement suggestion or reminder regarding the feature(i.e. Epic) and he/she wants to add that as a ticket to the Epic (not the Story because that will be closed and forgatten)

Currently the member has to check manually which Epic the Story belongs to on Work mode. There is a label there (Story details panel in Work mode), which is NOT a link so she has to switch back to Plan mode and search for the Epic, unfold, click on "Add ticket to Epic"... this is a painful task and huge demotivator!

Suggestion
 - make the Epic label on the Story details panel (Work Mode) a link to the Epic in Plan mode (from where the user can add a ticket to the Epic)
 - OR even better: make it possible from the Story details panel to add a ticket to same Epic the given Story belongs to
fields.summary: As a Scrum Master/Team member I want to add issues to an Epic from Work Mode much quicker

fields.description:
Or at least there should be a warning/question that there are open Stories and whether I want to close them as well with the Epic.

Closed Epics with open Stories do not make too much sense and confuse team members
fields.summary: As a Scrum Master if I close an Epic I want all its Stories to be closed as well

fields.description: An indicator would be perfect on the planning board (eg. red font color) for those Epics which have Stories (one or more) that are included in the current Sprint
fields.summary: As a Scrum Master I want to see which Epics are in a Sprint

fields.description:
Currently I can d&d epics to set their order but there is no visible indicators like estimations, remaining hours, business importance, anything for epics this makes prioritization a painful task.

Most important indicators would be: sum of estimated hours (I can see them, but only if i unfold them one by one one), sum of remaining hours, but configurable fields would be the best
fields.summary: As a Product Owner I want to prioritize my epics based on numbers

fields.description: Need a basic regression test for creating from the Tools menu
fields.summary: Create a new automated test for "Create Board"

fields.description:
Since ADG, following method incorrectly ranks issues:

GH.PlanRankController.rankCreatedIssuesByVisibility

The scrolling isn't properly applied to the calculation.

--
This method is used when no issues are currently selected and a new issue is created, the purpose is to place the new issue on the screen the user is currently looking at. The bug places the issue incorrectly but does scroll to it.
fields.summary: Ranking an issue according to backlog visibility incorrect
DnD on an expanded active sprint with no issues doesn't work

fields.description: GH.RemoveIssuesFromSprintDialog.showRemoveIssuesFromSprintDialog(ctx.selectedIssues, ctx.sprint);
fields.summary: Warn when removing issues from an active sprint

fields.description:
In context menu it says "Add flag", in cog menu it says "Flag" they should be the same. 

Also Unflag / Remove flag is not consistent.
fields.summary: Make text consistent

fields.description:
The {{UpdatingStatus}} action is vulnerable to stored XSS when outputting an unsanitized {{name}} parameter. Exploitation of this issue first requires creating a status containing HTML markup. File: greenhopper\src\main\resources\templates\greenhopper\jira\boards\taskboard\Actions\Task-options.vm {code:title=Task-options.vm|borderStyle=vm} ... #foreach($tAction in $transitionBoard.availableActions)
    • ... {code} !Status_persistent_XSS_configure.PNG! !Status_persistent_XSS.PNG!
fields.summary: UpdatingStatus Persistent XSS

fields.description:
The {{UpdatePField}} action is vulnerable to reflected XSS when passing an unsanitized {{fieldId}} parameter to the {{Issue-confirmation.vm}} velocity template. This issue can be tested with a specially crafted link, such as: [http://10.211.55.9/secure/UpdatePField.jspa?fieldId=');%3C/script%3E%3Cscript%3Ealert('XSS&fieldValue=1&key=SSP-6&id=11519&stepId=-1&decorator=none&selectedProjectId=10202&pageType=PlanningBoard&subType=VersionBoard&type=VB&selectedBoardId=-1&colPage=1] File: greenhopper\src\main\Resources\Atlassian-plugin.xml {code:xml} ... /templates/greenhopper/jira/issue/actions/issue-confirmation.vm /templates/greenhopper/jira/issue/actions/issue-confirmation.vm {code} File:greenhopper\src\main\resources\templates\greenhopper\jira\issue\Actions\Issue-confirmation.vm {code:title=Issue-confirmation.vm|borderStyle=solid} #disable_html_escaping() #if(!$action.errors.isEmpty()) #foreach($error in $action.errors)$action.getText($error)
#end #else ##POSSIBLEXSS #end {code} !UpdatePFieldXSS_browser.PNG!
fields.summary: UpdatePField Reflected XSS

fields.description:
Given the situation that there is 2 or more boards connected to the same project. (Boards A and B, for example). Both of them have planned sprints created (but not started yet).

When Board A places Issue A into their planned sprint, then Issue A also appears in the planned sprint for Board B (even if the planned sprints are using different names).

This can cause confusion among the boards, as the team working on Board B might not want to work on Issue A in their sprint. It would be better if the planned sprint is linked to the board, so once a ticket goes into a planned sprint, it's not shown in the backlog or planned sprint of any other board
fields.summary: Make issues exclusive to a planned sprint of a board

fields.description: Epic name does not render, and issue is created without success message or epic link.
fields.summary: Creating an 'issue in epic' from JIRA issue nav's Detail View doesn't link with epic name

fields.description:
The following analytics events should be fired :

h4. Adding and deleting sprints

Category: (old name => new name)
gh.rapidboard.sprint.backlog => gh.rapidboard.sprint.controller

Actions:  (old name => new name)
addmarker => addsprint
deletemarker => deletesprint

h4. moving issues around

Category: 
gh.sprint.issue

Old actions:
add/remove

New actions:
movebetweenfuturesprints
movebetweenactivesprints
movefromfuturetoactivesprint
movefromactivetofuturesprint
addtoactivesprint
addtofuturesprint
removefromfuturesprint
removefromactivesprint

The event gh.rapidboard.rankissues.dragAndDrop is also triggered whenever an issue is moved

h4. Starting a sprint

Category:
gh.start.sprint.dialog.change

Event type: 
start (when dialog opened)
complete (when sprint started)

Category
gh.start.sprint.metadata (stored for every started sprint)

Event Types
numIssues
sprintDuration
totalStatistic

h4. Editing sprints

Category
gh.edit.sprint.inlineedit.change

Event type
update => updateactive or updatefuture
fields.summary: check all analytics events on sprint-buckets branch

fields.description:
- Selection should jump between sprints and backlog
- collapsed sprints should be ignored
(behaviour references swimlane j/jk navigation)
fields.summary: Fix up j/k behaviour
Sprints displayed on issue page agile panel

fields.description: - Make sure only active/future sprints are shown
fields.summary: Check Report mode Sprint Selection

fields.description: Keyboard shortcuts, issue actions, etc.
fields.summary: Test all ranking stuff
Editing of Sprint name,start and end date
Visibility of sprint issues not updated upon instant filtering

fields.description:
- Dragging the marker
- Dragging and issue
- Both can't be placed between footer/header
- Dragging from Backlog to Epics/Versions
fields.summary: Fix up Plan Drag and Drop

fields.description: Should move to the top of the first future sprint / backlog
fields.summary: Look at Remove from Sprint behaviour

fields.description: It should not be editable.
fields.summary: Epic Link field is editable for sub-tasks

fields.description:
JIRA does not support searching the 'Global Rank' field with operators other then 'is' or 'is not'. I would like the JQL function to support more operators like '<', '>' or '<=', '>=' (you get the point).
Use case; several of my users want to search their 'Rapid Board backlog filter' for issues 'above' a certain userstory in the backlog.
fields.summary: As JIRA i want to support more operators for the 'Global Rank' type field

fields.description:
It would be convenient if I could configure quick filters to function as an OR search. 

For instance, if I use a set labels for my various user stories, where each story is assigned one label, it would be nice to be able to create quick filters for each label, and then use the filters  in Plan or Work mode to only view issues with, for example, labels 'A', 'B', and 'C' at the same time.

Currently, if I click on filters 'A' and 'B', nothing will shows up, since quick filters function as an AND search.

I know that I could define the filters as Labels != "A", and so on, but it would be preferred to simply be able to configure a board to apply quick filters as an OR search.

(I initially tried creating this issue in the GreenHopper project, but it does not have an 'Improvement' issue type, so I'm creating it here in the JIRA project instead. Hope that's okay.)
fields.summary: Ability to configure quick filters to function as OR searches instead of AND searches

fields.description:
As Patrick, I want to be guided when creating a board so I don't get lost in the process.

CoS:

- The dialog consists of three parts:
-- Board type (Scrum, Kanban)
-- Project/Filter (create new project, choose existing, specify saved filter)
-- leftovers: sample data on/off, workflow (JIRA vs GH Simplified)
- this dialog replaces the existing ones present in:
-- create new scrum board
-- create new kanban board
-- create new DIY board
-- the dialog available from the cog menu (incl Manage Boards)
- the "DIY" option is removed from the "Getting Started" screen as it is effectively obsolete
- if Scrum or Kanban mode is chosen from the "Getting Started" screen, then the wizard should start at step 2 (i.e. we already know if it's scrum or kanban)
- the text inviting you to create new project or choose existing on "Getting Started" needs rewording so it simply opens the dialog -- remove the two "1" and "2" things and replace with just "1".
- the link to create a sample project should be rewired to use the new wizard and take you directly to creating the project with sample data and workflow options already selected.

(!) Dev Notes (!)

Q: What if there are no existing projects to select?
A: Skip the step to choose and go straight to create new project

Q: What if there are no filters to select from?
A: No option to choose to create from a filter

Q: What if the user has no permissions to create a project?
A: menu link or button disabled; getting started text changes and does not show option to create

Q: For OnDemand, what if the user doesn't have all application permissions to create a project?
A: menu link or button disabled; getting started text changes and does not show option to create

Q: What if there is a large number of existing projects?
A: Drop down is really long

Q: What if there are a large number of filters?
A: Drop down is really long

Q: What if the user does not have permission to see some/all filters?
A: They won't appear in the list

Q: Are selections persisted between board creations?
A: No

Q: Does scrolling through all the panes persist selections?
A: Back / Next through pages should persist selections

Q: Is there proper XSS escaping for filters and projects?
A: Yes

Q: What if the window is resized?
A: Dialog stays the same size

Q: Does the create button disable/spinner after pressed?
A: There is a spinner.

Q: What happens if the operation is cancelled after the create button is pressed?
A: Within the process the dialog just goes away and no board is created. After the final button is pressed the page will reload and go to board, no cancel button. 

Q: Has this been checked from plan, work, and report? Manage Boards, Board Configuration, and Getting Started all the same?
A: Link will be in menu for Manage Boards, Plan, Work and Report. 

Q: Will the dialog not render properly in some browsers?
A: No, it will always be beautiful. 
A2: In JIRA 5.1, 5.2 the dialog has some differences as expected.
fields.summary: Wizard-like Create Board dialog

fields.description: If I'm on the work board and I want to view or edit a ticket's epic, I have to 1. open the ticket in jira, 2. click on the epic label there.
fields.summary: make epics labels a link in work mode

fields.description:
I'd like a compact swimlane view -- something like the current "all closed", but with a visual indicator of how many issues are in each column. This could be done with numbers, or, even better, with a highly compressed view of the tickets that only took a few pixels -- almost like a stacked column chart, or think "equalizer"[1] -- that could then be expanded. This would allow me to get an overall picture of the sprint in a single screen.

[1] http://www.clker.com/cliparts/w/J/f/A/a/W/music-equalizer.svg
fields.summary: compact swimlane view

fields.description:
We are just about to release and for some reason, 

we can't get https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/FECRU-3461 onto our board

https://jira.atlassian.com/secure/RapidBoard.jspa?rapidView=243&view=planning&selectedIssue=FECRU-3462

That issue appears to be stuck on an outdated board called FECRU Releases. Could someone with permissions please delete that board, and then try and get FECRU-3461 on our board called FECRU Scrum ?

Cheers,
Nick
fields.summary: Why is this issue not appearing on our Scrum Board?

fields.description:
It is important to see if the ticket I am about to work on is part of the original commitment or if it has been added as additional work afterwards. Only like this I can make an educated decision about if I should start working on this ticket first or if I risk missing the originally committed scope.

Mockup (see the \*):
!rapidboard_work_mode_scope_change.png!
fields.summary: As a GH user, I want to have an indicator that shows if a ticket belongs to the original commitment or has been added as a scope change

fields.description:
We have a big problem with the burndowns Greenhopper generates, because they do indicate scope changes. This frequently brings up questions about the teams being on or off track.

*Imagine the following scenario:*
Team Rocket committed to burn down 100 story points. Halfway into the sprint, they have already burned down most of the committed story points and some of the team members start to work on other issues of the backlog. Since everything needs to be tracked, they pull them into the active sprint. These scope changes now lead to confusion about if the team is still working on the original commitment or on additional work.

*There are two options:*
# The team is on track, which means it has burned down most of the original committed stories and everybody should be cheering
# The team is off track, because even though their burndown looks nice, they have been working on stuff that has been pulled in as scope changes and they have not worked on some of the originally committed stories.

A possible solution could be to render two different graphs, one for the original scope excluding scope changes (yellow) and one containing both  the original scope and the scope changes (red):

!burndown_ontrack_legend.png!

_Note: This is a mockup and the actual curve might not be 100% correct._

We found ourselves in a situation where we would get nervous calls from our directors asking why our burndowns look so bad and if we can make it while our SCRUM masters were totally satisfied, because the teams had actually a better throughput and pulled in additional work. The other way around, a burndown could look good, but originally committed work had been ignored.

*This is a real showstopper for us!*
fields.summary: As a SCRUM master, I want my burndowns to show if my team is REALLY on track

fields.description:
Currently, only user with Edit Permission in the projects able to add issues to sprint. 

However, there are some use case where by projects are interrelated and the other project dependent on other project's issues to be resolved. So, having the ability to nominate an issue to be fix in the next sprint in another project is important in this scenario.
fields.summary: Specific permission to add an issue to a Sprint (or remove an issue from a Sprint)

fields.description: In an epic's view issue page, the create issue in epic dialog preselect the epic in the new issue's epic link field. The text shown in the disabled field is velocity markup
fields.summary: Disabled epic link field bleeds velocity markup

fields.description:
In Greenhopper 6.1.2 the topbar is fixed, the plan/work/reports boards are in an iFrame or so. This is very annoying when you use GH on a big screen in a meeting room. You zoom in so everybody can read the stories, but now you loose a lot of space by the fixed top-bar.

Please, please, make the whole screen scrollable again. Or add an option to hide the complete top-bar.
fields.summary: In the new Greenhopper, the top-bar is fixed, very annoying!

fields.description:
The updates to the Kanban board recently are great.

We use these views as a bit of an overview for a mixture of scrum teams and a little bit of forward planning and visibility for our stakeholders.

In the collapsed view, it would be great to see the count of tickets in each swimlane/column when the swimlanes are collapsed.

I've attached a loose mock up to explain my point a little further, I'm no UX designer as you can see...
fields.summary: As a Kanban Board user, I want to view a ticket count across each of my swimlanes when they are collapsed

fields.description:
We restarted the server and Greenhopper had an issue starting up. Receive this error:

java.sql.SQLException: ORA-00604: error occurred at recursive SQL level 1
ORA-20900: User JIRA is not allowed to run DDL at any time.

Please call me at 6505531418
fields.summary: Greenhopper receive and internal error cannot startup

fields.description: This messages are too long to fit. Not sure what is the best translation. Maybe just say "Alle Bahnen ..."
fields.summary: German i18n message does not fit

fields.description: When a board has a great number of Completed Sprints, it becomes very hard to browse through those Sprints while generating reports (Sprint report, for example). The list can get so large that users can't see most recent Sprints unless they shrink their resloution way down, or view it on a bigger monitor. Providing the ability to archive or delete old Sprints would certainly make a good improvement.
fields.summary: Provide the ability to archive completed Sprints

fields.description:
some of my team work in the UK, some in the US.  We have different public holidays (and people take vacations).  It'd be nice to be able to configure different non-working days for different team members so that the burndown better tracks the expected velocity through the sprint.

Ie. if only 50% of people are working on a given day then the burndown for that day should show 50% of the work rate.
fields.summary: Support configuring different non-working days for different team members

fields.description:
Initially when we create a sprint, we have stories with remaining estimates that are our best guess for completing the whole story.  Then individual developers break down the tasks into subtasks as they do the back-of-envelope design for the task.

The problem that we have is that when we create subtasks, the parent task also has its own remaining estimate and the two get summed (when really the subtask is just a part of the parent task, not an addition).

At the moment, we manually adjust the parent estimate down when adding a subtask but it'd be easier if we could have a "post action" at creation of the subtask that reduced the parent estimate accordingly.
fields.summary: Add option for subtasks to "steal" time from parent at creation
Unable to select latest versions in Version Report in Scrum Board
velocity bleeding some markup if epic name has tags
Tags in Epic name stop Split View from loading the issue details
IE9 - clicking an epic link with tags in name causes infinite spinner on View Issue page

fields.description:
This needs to cover wallboards too.

CoS:

# Right click context menu should be available for parent issue swimlane
## The menu only contains one option which is to Add or Remove Flag (depending on state)
## Menu is only opened when right-clicking not on a control inside the swimlane (i.e. not on the issue key, not on the "transition", not on the twixie)
# The option should be available via Cog menu (already present)
# Flagged state needs to be visible in Wallboard Gadget

(!) Dev Notes (!)
Q: What if the JQL swimlane is defined as a single issue?
A: You can't flag it

Q: Does it work if the swimlane is collapsed/expanded?
A: It still appears as flagged and you can still flag it. 

Q: Does it work in all supported browsers?
A: yes
fields.summary: Flagging on stories as swimlanes in work mode

fields.description:
See screenshot for clarification.

It would be useful to be able to add/remove columns shown on the detail pane.
fields.summary: As a user, I would the ability to customize sub-task columns displayed in the detail pane

fields.description:
h3.Scenario 
You can create sprints at a scrum board and after the sprint is over, there may be more steps before the code is released. And this steps can be done at an kanban Rapid Board. Once you click in an issue at an kanban board, there is no information on what sprint it belongs to, as you can see in the attached screenshot, unless you click in the link for the issue that sends you to the issue screen with all the information. 

There should be an option to add a field in the detail screen at the rapid board that can display this information.

!screenshot.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: As a Rapid Board user I would like to see the Sprint the issue belongs in the detail view
Improve accuracy of version report and allow to get a gadget

fields.description:
As can be seen in the image, cog the menu does not really reveal that all of these options are for the *Scrum Board* except the *Create board* point:
!scrum_board.JPG|thumbnail!

This can cause users to  inadvertently delete their *Scrum Board* while deleting unnecessary issues in their projects.

Of course, there is option to choose to use the keyboard shortcut or bulk operations but as users are also provided with the cog menu and that one also can include a "Delete" point, this creates confusion for users.

Suggestion to tackle this matter is to have the board menu items are all written out like *Delete Board*, *Copy Board*, etc. just like the *Create Board*.
fields.summary: Improvement in GreenHopper Scrum Board Cog Menu

fields.description:
I would like to be able to mark a "red line" just below the Minimum Marketable Feature set (MMF), in the "plan" tab of Greenhopper (Rapidboard version(s), not the classic one).

While I do communicate to the team what these are, it would be good for them to be able to see where it is without having to ask.

I think it would make sense to place the "red line" in the left-hand Epic column, and be able to drag it around, just like Epics.

Many thanks for any consideration!
fields.summary: Backlog Marker for Minimum Marketable Feature Set

fields.description:
See screenshot.

Also is triggered when viewing in Agile Issue Web Panel.

Can also occur when typing directly into the field (e.g. typing a script tag).
fields.summary: Script is executed when typing in Epic Link field
Epic name autocorrect is displaying names that don't match what I've typed

fields.description: It only starts to display names when you type something.
fields.summary: Should JQL display keys and names when you haven't typed anything?

fields.description: Telling users it's GH-only is not particularly helpful when they are editing an issue.
fields.summary: Update the "Epic Link" description

fields.description: Since we're displaying it now by default in the details section, and not in the agile section, then for consistency we should call it "Epic" not "Epic Link"
fields.summary: Rename "Epic Link" to "Epic"

fields.description:
Dear All,

if you create a sprint and then add some issues to that and then you click on the link 'View in Issue Navigator', you get an error:

sun.security.validator.ValidatorException: PKIX path building failed: sun.security.provider.certpath.SunCertPathBuilderException: unable to find valid certification path to requested target

Why is that?

We use Jira v5.2.8

Thansk in advance for help!

Rumi

fields.description:
Additional filtering of 'Epic' items to remove issues not connected with an epic.

Current - 
Selecting each epic in the left panel of the plan board will reduce the backlog to the associated issues for that epic.  On a large backlog it does not demonstrate the rank of these issues

Preferred - 
Right-click option on the backlog to 'Grey non-epic issues'.  This would allow the backlog to be displayed, demonstrating the ranking, while making epic associated issues easy to identify.  This is demonstrated in the attachment.
fields.summary: Epic Filtering within Plan mode

fields.description: Says issue does not exist, but actually it cannot resolve because there is a duplicate.
fields.summary: Typing the name of a duplicate epic results in incorrect error message

fields.description: the epic that doesn't exist is listed as "key:EPIC-xx". should remove key
fields.summary: Error message incorrect if an Epic is typed in that doesn't exist

fields.description: We would need to consider the case when the field options were previously modified.
fields.summary: As an administrator I would like the Flagged field to be managed by GH so that I don't shoot myself in the foot.
